text: Chechen War may refer to: * Arab–Khazar wars, 642–799 * Mongol invasions of Chechnya, 13th and 14th centuries, Mongol invasions of Dzurdzuketia * Russo- Turkish War (1787–1792), unsuccessful attempt by the Ottoman Empire to regain lands lost to the Russian Empire * Battle of the Sunja, 1785, between Russian Empire and Chechen forces of Sheikh Mansur * Chechen–Russian conflict, 1785–present * Caucasian War, 1817–1864 * Murid War, 1829–1859, a.k.a. Russian Conquest of Chechnya and Dagestan * 1940–44 insurgency in Chechnya * The , 1993–1994 * First Chechen War, December 1994–August 1996 * War of Dagestan, 1999 * Second Chechen War, 1999–2009 * 2001 Kodori crisis, 2001 * Pankisi Gorge crisis, 2001–2003 * War in Ingushetia, began in 2007 * Russo-Georgian War, August 2008 * Insurgency in the North Caucasus, 2009–present
title: Chechen War
